body.name: The Keeper of Happy Endings
body.description: An enchanting novel about fate, second chances, and hope, lost and found, by the Amazon Charts bestselling author of The Last of the Moon Girls.Soline Roussel is well schooled in the business of happy endings. For generations her family has kept an exclusive bridal salon in Paris, where magic is worked with needle and thread. It’s said that the bride who wears a Roussel gown is guaranteed a lifetime of joy. But devastating losses during World War II leave Soline’s world and heart in ruins and her faith in love shaken. She boxes up her memories, stowing them away, along with her broken dreams, determined to forget.Decades later, while coping with her own tragic loss, aspiring gallery owner Rory Grant leases Soline’s old property and discovers a box containing letters and a vintage wedding dress, never worn. When Rory returns the mementos, an unlikely friendship develops, and eerie parallels in Rory’s and Soline’s lives begin to surface. It’s clear that they were destined to meet—and that Rory may hold the key to righting a forty-year wrong and opening the door to shared healing and, perhaps, a little magic.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Oh my heart 😭
reviews.reviewText: This book broke my heart and made me cry multiple times 😭😭 but I'm so glad there is a happy ending. Well, I hope I'm not ruining that for anyone. I mean it's in the title. Of course there is a happy ending, but before getting there, your heart will break so many times while reading this masterpiece. I absolutely loved this beautiful book. I don't even know how to describe it. Barbara Davis is a master storyteller and this is truly a masterpiece. There are two parallel storylines. In the past (during WWII), two young lovers separated by war and kept apart because of a cruel father's lies. Then in the present timeline (which is the 80s), a young woman is navigating life as a gallery owner who's suddenly lost in touch with her fiancee, who is doctor in a warzone, for several months. The two stories are woven together beautifully and when you finally see how the two are connected, it all makes sense. It's a lesson in dealing with past hurts, lies, and wounds, forgiveness, and acceptance. It's a story about love and not just between lovers, but between mothers and daughters, grandparents, brothers and sisters. All kinds of love are explored in this story.It was a bit of a slow start, but the second half of the book picked up and you are pulled into the scene and feel all the emotions. I love the quotes by the dress witch at the beginning of Soline's chapters. They are all little nuggets of wisdom about love, life and perspective. I found myself highlighting some of them and rereading them again and again. I think I need to reread this book again to truly appreciate the details of the story. I missed a lot of things in the middle, especially when I was listening to some of it on audiobook. The voice of Soline has a heavy French accent so it's sometimes difficult to hear what she's saying clearly. But I like that they used the French accent to make the character come to life.I thoroughly enjoyed it and will definitely be checking out more of Barbara Davis's books. This is the second book I've read by her now and I've become a huge fan.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderfully crafted book. Captivating!
reviews.reviewText: I can't say enough good things about this book. It grabbed my heart from the first chapter. The journey through the lives of these two women is heart-wrenching and so very real feeling. I haven't read a book like this in such a very long time. The author has a wonderful way of crafting the story. Not only does it capture your attention, but more importantly, it paints a picture that is so evocative that you can see feel and almost smell what she describes. A feast for those with any imagination.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A Very Imaginative Novel
reviews.reviewText: Wow! Author Davis has spun a tale like none other with twists and turns, sadness and grief focused on two women, one young and one not, who finally come together in a very surprising fashion. At the conclusion, the novel finally lives up to its title.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I fell in love with this book. Very cleaver with the way the story line keeps your attention. I read this book in 3 days which is fast for me. I’m already looking for another book by this author. Her way of telling a story makes you feel like you’re in the room with the character and can see the story take place. The story of 3 generations of looking and finding love they thought they would never find again, yet it was right there all along.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Profound lessons about the pursuit of happiness
reviews.reviewText: “The Keeper of Happy Endings" is a delightful and enchanting read that effortlessly transports readers to a world of imagination and joy. The author's storytelling is masterful, creating a magical tapestry of characters and settings. This book not only weaves a compelling narrative but also imparts profound lessons about the pursuit of happiness and the importance of cherishing life's simple joys. With its whimsical charm and heartwarming messages, "The Keeper of Happy Endings" is a literary gem that leaves a lasting smile on your face. Highly recommended for those seeking a delightful escape into a world of wonder and positivity.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A story across time.
reviews.reviewText: A love story starts across the ocean in World War ll. Then Anson sends his finance`to the States to keep her safe. When she arrives at his father's estate she did not know of his wealth. The father is very rude to her. Ansons sister just adores her soon to be sister-in- law. Read and find out what this horrible father does and how it all plays out. A wonderful story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars very very sweet story
reviews.reviewText: It’s a lovely story! It took me longer to finish the book than I thought it would. The story kept unfolding! Enjoy it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars long but worth it!
reviews.reviewText: I do not read romance novels and this is not one, but it is a love story that is well written.At first I wasn’t sure I would continue reading this book because it just didn’t seem like my kind of thing. At some point though it piqued my interest enough to keep going; and I’m happy that I finished the book and enjoyed it!
Loved every page of this beautiful and mesmerizing story. A true gift of love dreams. A must read for sure
I just love it, it perfectly blends romanticism with harder realities…I especially liked the magic references to “La Mere”… magnificent
It was a riveting read ! Although I had guessed the ending as the story was unfolding , yet it was worth reading till the end .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The more I read the more I wanted to read. An enchanting book of love, loss and faith in hope.

Eine rührende und wundervolle Geschichte, die Vergangenheit und Gegenwart vereint. Ein bisschen Magie, viel Herzschmerz, aber auch eine zauberhafte Liebesgeschichte gleich mit zwei Happy Endings. Absoluter Pageturner.
